comments:
Create a set of programs in a project and execute them in Debug
mode. Eclipse hangs...

The above happened while I tried to test by giving breakpoint at
the setup function in the VectorTest.java of the JUnit project.
And it also, failed while trying to debug the plug-in project
com.example.xyz as explained in the manual. If it does not fail,
try to pick some random program to debug from the list of programs,
that had been already executed. 

I will include the error log on the above in my next posting.

Platform: HP-UX B 11.11 U 64 bit, PA8500
JAVA: J2RE SE 1.3.1.05
Eclipse: V2.0 pre-release, Stable 20020624(GM)
Desktop: CDE 2.1.0
Motif: V2.1.0
Can we expect an error log?

Your bug report says that Eclipse hangs, but your log is for a VM crash.

Also, the crash in the log didn't occur when you were debugging, it occurred 
when you were doing refactoring.

Is this log related to the problem you reported?

Well, I thought about this. But, I was wrong in the log. Ok,
I have to go back and test it on the HP-UX 11.11 system and try
to reproduce the problem.(somwhere, I must have saved the 
incorrect log) I will try to reproduce the problem 
on 11.0 and see anything I can provide. Since, when it hangs do
we get any logs is my suspicion. Anycase, I will try my
best. Were you able to reproduce?

I have tried two debug scenarios (simple Java program and self hosted 
workspace) and not had any problems debugging or hitting breakpoints.

From the stack trace it looks like the error occurred while closing the 
workbench which may be fixed by specifying


    -vmargs -XdoCloseWithReadPending

Sridhar, can you reproduce this problem every time? Can you reproduce it with 
a fresh workspace?

Also, when it hangs, how long have you let it go to see if it recovers?

The next time this happens, please look in your .log file (in the .metadata 
directory in your workspace) and see if there are any messages written just 
before Eclipse hangs. Please note the timestamps on the messages in the log 
and make sure they match up to the time that the error occurred.

Ok! I tried on HP-UX 11.0, and it seems to work fine.
I did look into both the error log view and the <workspace>/.metadata/*.log
file. It is just that, I missed to take the log immediately
and copied the wrong one. When I bring back the workbench,
it comes back with all the projects I was working on, and with
only resource perspective shown. But, if you try to
run it again, it works fine. And, I went on to register this
bug, since it happened to me couple of times. I gave it more
than a minute before concluding it was hung.

Sridhar, 
Is it your opinion that this bug can be closed?

Here is one that I possibly think might be the one. But,
in any case with the new GM5 build I tried to create couple
of java programs and tried to debug, it never failed.

Hi all, Sorry for the confusion, I tried to debug a simple 
JDT UI program VectorTest.java, given the break point at setup() 
method and the debug perspective gets executed without any problems. 
Eclipse stable drop build GM5(20020627) was used to perform this 
test.

I am forwarding my eclipse installation & the project to Kevin Haaland
for further verification. It is just that, debug perspective works fine
on many instances. But, yesterday, when I was working on the 
com.example.xyz plugin project it use to fail consistently and I thought, 
I found an instance, where it happens. This morning, I come and open
up the same project it works just fine. My conclusion, their are certain 
conditions where debug perspective just hangs. 
Again, I did a fresh install of GM5 today and created the plug-in project
as I did yesterday, and the eclipse hung. In any case, all the details
will be sent to Kevin Haaland for further verfication.
Kevin Haaland and others have had no success reproducing this problem.
marking as "works for me" unless there is a reproduceable problem.

traces.message: Launching failed. Plugin "org.eclipse.core.boot" is missing or does not contain "boot.jar" library (if in workspace, check that boot.jar is on the project's classpath).     21
